Dear Graydon;
Thanks for the September 10 copy of your letter to Schooley.
You are quite right in your prodding. By now you will also
have received, under separate cover, a copy of the Ford Foun¬
dation letter which indicates why some of my energies have
gone with another kind of prodding.
I wish you would collect as many ideas of your own as possible
for an “interior” transcribed net in the event our
large scale plans run into hazards.
If you could possibly come to Ann Arbor a day early it would
have a great deal of merit, as we are going to have one heck
of a lot of business; and if we can get rolling before the
general meeting, it will certainly help.
Yours sincerely.
President
